post_text:
Attn Parents and Students participating in Asynchronous Remote Instruction: All 6th-12th grade students need to log into your grade level Zoom daily at the assigned time to receive information, help and daily contact with Mrs. Farr, the CCISD Secondary Liason. She can help with log in issues, check for assignments and completed work, answer questions, contact your class teacher with your questions, etc. If you have any questions about this program or need the log in information , please contact your campus principal. The times are listed below:

6th Grade 8:00-8:30 a.m.
7th Grade 9:00-9:30 a.m.
8th Grade 10:00-10:30 a.m.
9th Grade 11:00-11:30 a.m.
10th Grade 12:00-12:30 p.m.
11th Grade 1:00-1:30 p.m.
12th Grade 2:00-2:30

The Elementary teachers will be contacting students through Google Classroom or email with times for daily contact with Asynchronous Remote students.

How ‘bout that Cross Country Team!! Great showing by both the varsity girls and boys today at the Jana Broxson Memorial Cross Country Invitational. post_text:
Bulldog Nation,

I wanted to take a moment to commend every single student, teacher, staff member, custodian, cafeteria worker, bus driver, and maintenance worker.

We have been in school for one month now. Because everyone on our campuses have followed the COVID-19 protocols we developed, we have only had three individuals test positive for COVID-19 since the start of the school year. None of these three cases originated from the school. All three cases originated at home.

I am so proud of our Corrigan-Camden ISD family for working hard to ensure that our facilities are a safe place for students to learn and participate in extracurricular activities.

Thank you to each and every one of you for all that you do for the students of our district! Have a great Labor Day weekend, stay safe, social distance, wear your mask, and I will see you all back on Tuesday, September 8th.

We Are Bulldog Nation!

Richard A. Cooper
Superintendent
Corrigan-Camden ISD

post_text:
Bulldog Nation,

Tickets for Friday night's Varsity Football game are on sale in the High School Office. Seating is limited to one half of the stadium's capacity, which is 1,357 seats. They will be sold first-come, first-served. We will sell tickets until Thursday afternoon. We will also sell tickets at the gate Friday night as well.

We will still honor UIL and Senior Citizen passes. However, you will need to use your pass to get a ticket. We recommend that everyone using one of these passes get their tickets early.

Just remember that if we sell out of tickets, we will be forced to limit access to the game. It is important to buy your tickets in advance if you want to guarantee yourself a seat at Friday's game.

Richard A. Cooper
Superintendent
Corrigan-Camden ISD

post_text:
Attention! Time sensitive information.

Corrigan-Camden HS is participating in the ACT school day again this year. This allows the student to take the ACT during a school day and at our school.

If you are interested in this testing option then please let Mrs Gardner know!

The test day will be on October 6,2020.

The ACT test cost $42.

Please note that you will have to pay for the test up front in order to have a seat. If you have a passing score then you will be reimbursed for your test!

Please respond to this email by noon Friday, August 28th at the latest if you are interested in this option.

Payment is due in full by Thursday Sept. 3.

Attention C-CISD Family!

We are experiencing impacts due to heavy evacuation traffic.

If you are able, you may pick up your students early today at each campus' main office. We are also going to release high school students that drive to leave campus at 2:00 p.m. We will run afternoon bus routes at our normal times.

If you have any questions please call your student's campus.

post_text:
C-CISD Family,

Due to the Westward shift in Hurricane Laura, and mandatory evacuations of counties to our South along the Gulf Coast, we will close school and operations on Wednesday, August 26th and Thursday, August 27th. We will not have remote instruction on these two dates.

We will continue to monitor the situation and traffic issues, and determine when we will return to school. It is our hope to return on Monday, August 31st.

We will communicate this information via email, mass text messages, the C-CISD Facebook page, and local media outlets.

Stay safe, and we will continue to distribute information as it becomes available.

post_text: We are so excited to see our students next week. This a reminder that we will begin classes on Monday, August 10 either in school or by remote learning. We will run buses for any students who need transportation, but are encouraging parents to bring and pick up children, if possible, to reduce the number of students on buses. All bus riders will be required to wear masks while on the bus and will be separated as much as possible.

post_text:
UPDATE: Deadline has now been extended until August 21.
Click the link below to apply.

FOOD BENEFIT FOR FAMILIES

All CCISD students qualify for this one time benefit.

Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. The P-EBT application is now open. Click this link: https://yourtexasbenefits.com/Learn/PEBT

Thousands of families across Texas have applied for the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program. However, there are still many more students that are eligible for this program.

post_text:
Our little PreK students were inadvertently left off the form. Please fill out a form if your PreK student will be attending.

Parents: We value and need your input for our back to school plans. Please complete a separate survey for EACH child you have attending C-CISD, whether in person or virtually (online only) for 2020-2021.

Information to help make your choice:

*We will offer two forms of instruction at C-CISD, in person at the school, and virtual instruction (online only).

*Attendance will be taken daily if you are attending school virtually or at school.

*Students that attend school virtually will have to watch videos of their lessons on Google Classroom and complete assignments each day. If you do not, they will be counted Absent.

*Students that attend school virtually will need access to dependable internet service.

*Students that attend school virtually will not be able to participate in any extracurricular activities.
shared_text:

C-CISD Back to School Survey
text:
Our little PreK students were inadvertently left off the form. Please fill out a form if your PreK student will be attending.

Parents: We value and need your input for our back to school plans. Please complete a separate survey for EACH child you have attending C-CISD, whether in person or virtually (online only) for 2020-2021.

Information to help make your choice:

*We will offer two forms of instruction at C-CISD, in person at the school, and virtual instruction (online only).

*Attendance will be taken daily if you are attending school virtually or at school.

*Students that attend school virtually will have to watch videos of their lessons on Google Classroom and complete assignments each day. If you do not, they will be counted Absent.

*Students that attend school virtually will need access to dependable internet service.

*Students that attend school virtually will not be able to participate in any extracurricular activities.

DOCS.GOOGLE.COM
C-CISD Back to School Survey

post_text:
Bulldog Nation,

TEA has finally released their guidance on opening schools. We have waited on this information for over a month now. We are beginning today to develop a plan to start school as scheduled on August 4th.

We will be posting our plans to keep students and staff safe while attending school. The state has many regulations that we will be forced to follow. Our hope is to have all of our plans finalized by the end of next week.

We are going to be sending out a lot of information in the coming days. Please be patient, and if you have any questions, please contact C-CISD Central Office at 936-398-4040.

Thank you,

Richard A. Cooper
Superintendent
Corrigan-Camden ISD

HS Summer School Information!

Summer School for underclassmen will be July 6-16, Monday-Thursday from 8-12.

Edgenuity is still open for you to work. If your classes are finished by 4 pm on July 5th you will not have to attend summer school.

*You must be 100% complete with the class as well as have a grade of 70% or better.

*We are NOT checking out Chromebooks. They have been inventoried and powerwashed for the new school year.

If you are in need of transportation, please let the Front Office know as soon as possible.

post_text:
Welcome to your Senior Year Class of 2021!

We are allowing SENIORS to take a third AC class, at their own expense, this year!

This class MUST be ONLINE.

If there is room in your schedule, you will be assigned a class period to work on it. If there is no room in your schedule, you will need to work on it on your own time at home and on the weekends.

The class MUST be dual credit (count for college AND high school).

This is only an option, not a requirement!

Schedules are being made right now!

If you are interested, please contact Mrs. Gardner.

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.
P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

Jr. High
Virtual Field Trips - Visit the below places for the last week of school.
6th Grade
-Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History: Move at your own pace through the 360-degree room-by-room tour of every exhibit in the museum.
-NASA: Both Virginia's Langley Research Center and Ohio's Glenn Research Center offer online tours for free.
-National Aquarium: Walkthrough tropical waters to the icy tundra in this floor-by-floor tour of the famous, Baltimore-based aquarium.
7th Grade
-https://aqua.org/media/virtualtours/baltimore/index.html
8th Grade
-https://space.generationbeyondinschool.com/virtualfieldtrip

We miss all our students, stay safe and have a great Summer!

post_text:
Senior Celebration!

Hi, my name is David Lazcano and I am a Senior at Corrigan-Camden High School. I want to first thank my family, friends, teachers, and coaches who have supported me throughout my time at CCISD. Without your support and my faith in God, none of this would be possible. After Graduation, I plan on attending Lone Star College in Montgomery to complete the EMT program and Fire Academy. After completing these programs, I will become a full-time firefighter. I pray God guides me through this next chapter in my life.

Congratulations David!

post_text:
Senior Celebration!

Good morning,

I thank God for giving me the opportunity to seek a higher education at Houston Baptist University. I plan on majoring in civil engineering and work all around the US and even the world. I want to thank my parents for all the hard work they have done for the last 12 years to keep me on track, without my parents, God, and Faith graduating wouldn’t be possible. Thank you to Mr. Perez for being strict and for all the time he helped me out. Also thank you to Mrs. Juanita & Erika Soto.

Congratulation Rudy!

post_text:
Memories!
The Bulldog Growl will be in next Thursday's edition of the Polk County Enterprise, but we need your help.

Please send pictures of your child/children and their new "educational" experiences. We would like pictures of them doing their "C-C teacher assigned" work and their "Mom/Dad assigned" work. Working together we are educating our students.
Please send digital pictures to storrez@ccisdtx.com or 936-676-2109 of your children (include Mom, Dad, and siblings if possible) learning to read, play, enjoy nature, fish, play a musical instrument, create art, work, cook, solve math problems, learn about history, cleaning the house, planting a garden or a plant, etc. This can be a "selfie".
Please put your name, your child's name and grade, and what they are learning.

post_text:
High School Teachers Rock!

We wanted to let our high school teachers know that we appreciate them more than words can say. They always work hard for their students, but they have shown an inventiveness with distance learning that is amazing!

Thank you for caring enough to give it your all every day, from up close and at a distance! Our school is a better place for each and every one of you :)

We are so sorry that we were not able to appreciate you face-to-face this year! Look in your box for a little token of our appreciation when you come in next week :)

The link for the virtual ceremony will be provided in three ways: on the school website, on the school Facebook page, and via text/email message to the Class of 2020.

Certificates for those awarded will be included in the graduation packet the students will pick up in the week following the June 12th ceremony.

Happy School Nurses' Day to our awesome School Nurses.

Deana Parker and Kris Willson serve a vital role in keeping our students safe. These ladies work day after day trying to take care of our students' medical needs, providing education, protecting our students, and most importantly loving our students.

Ladies, thank you so very much for your dedication to the students of Corrigan-Camden ISD.

Happy School Nurses' Day!
Richard Cooper, Superintendent

post_text:
Graduation reminders!

Students and parents, make sure you remember the following:

Please arrive 5 minutes prior to your chosen timeslot and wait by the front doors. We will bring you in and show you where to go at your time.

Your six family members will be taken to their area and the graduate will be taken into the office for any final regalia. Then you will walk and receive your diploma sleeve and it will be videoed. You will then proceed on and take a picture after your tassel has been moved :) The videos and pictures will all be a part of the official graduation video presentation on May 22nd!

Wear your cap and gown! If you have earned any cords, etc., we will have them for you to use when you arrive.

We will have a place for your six family members to stand. They are welcome to take photos as you receive your diploma sleeve and as you move your tassel.

We would like to take a moment to thank our Principals at Corrigan-Camden ISD. These six individuals work tirelessly to ensure our students are safe, and provided the best education possible.

It is because of the work and dedication of our Principals that Corrigan-Camden ISD is the best school district in the state. I am proud of these individuals, and honored to entrust my child's education to them.

Sincerely,

Richard A. Cooper
Superintendent
Corrigan-Camden ISD

post_text:
I would like to take a moment to recognize and thank our School Lunch Heros! Our Food Service ladies have gone above and beyond to serve the children of this community. They continue to work every day to ensure our students have a nutritious lunch during this pandemic. They sacrifice and and spend extra time to prepare and deliver lunches all over our community.

They have worked with our Transportation Department to make sure our children get fed daily.

On behalf of C-CISD, thank you very much for feeding and loving our children. I can not put into words how much these people mean to our community!

Sincerely,

Richard A. Cooper
Superintendent
Corrigan-Camden ISD

post_text:
Elementary packets for weeks 7 and 8 are in the newspaper racks on the front sidewalk. If you have any packets to return, place them in the file cabinet drawer of your child’s grade level. Thanks!

If you have not communicated to your child’s teacher the method for which weeks 4-8 would be done (either printed packet or online using Education Galaxy) we need you to do that. If the teacher is not aware of how work is to be completed, it could result in your student receiving and I for incomplete.

Remember, please complete the progress monitoring survey each week. It has been texted out several times. You may also communicate this progress to the teacher instead of completing the survey.

shared_text:
Texas Education Agency
April 17 at 2:51 PM ·

Texas parents: We’re continuing to provide at-home instructional support for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, even though our school buildings remain closed. #txed
text:
Statement from Texas Education Agency

Texas Education Agency
April 17 at 2:51 PM ·

Elementary parents-packet drop offs can be done in the file cabinets on the front sidewalks. Just drop any completed packets in the correct drawer.

If you have library books to return, please place them in the bin labeled Library Books.

For weeks 4-6, paper packets are available for pick up or your child can login to Education Galaxy. Please communicate with the teacher regarding which method of school work your student is doing. If you need a packet and have not picked one up, we ask that you please do so ASAP. We will ask that these be returned no later than May 15, 2020.

For weeks 7-9, we will have assignments in Education Galaxy and printed packets available in about a week.

Thank you for helping us to help your children.

post_text: Thank you Carmen Jasso. We miss you and your wonderful kids!
shared_text:
Carmen Jasso
April 8 at 10:11 AM ·

I want to say publicly how proud I am of my children and their teachers!! No one was given a warning, they all just jumped into action and started trying to figure out ways to continue teaching and learning. Our teacher’s did not get to continue with their lessons plans and introduce new concepts. They didn’t send a bunch of junk that would frustrate parents and students alike. I have seen packets, zoom meetings, projects and FaceTime calls with friends. I mean seriously they even zoomed work out for athletics lol My High school kids jumped into action and started meeting expectations!! Not a single time have they come crying to me about how stupid or hard their work is. My Zeke the same and He is loving reading the Hatchet. My Bradley has felt a little overwhelmed at times but only because that’s just who he is. He loves learning and this ‘homeschool’ just isn’t for him lol With a little reassurance and me showing him this isn’t something new he gets it done. Here’s my crew at homecoming just being their Bulldog selves 🐾💙

post_text:
C-CISD Community,

In an effort to minimize the spread of the coronavirus in our community, available seating in the Corrigan-Camden ISD Special Called Board Meeting on Tuesday, April 7, 2020 will be limited to essential personnel. The Special Called Meeting will be live-streamed.

We will publish the link to the live stream as soon as it is available.

Members of the public wishing to comment may be allowed to enter the High School and Board Room to address the Board one at a time. Upon entering the building, we ask all employees and members of the public to maintain a safe social distance of at least 6 feet from all other persons as much as possible. Due to the fact, this is a Special Called Meeting, Board Policy BED (LOCAL) states public comment shall be limited to items on the agenda posted with notice of the meeting.

C-CISD is following the lead of the Polk County Commissioner’s Court while the Declaration of Local Disaster for Public Health Emergency in Polk County remains in place in conducting public meetings.

Thank you,

Richard A. Cooper

Superintendent

Corrigan-Camden ISD

Attention HS parents and students!

No one will be working in the high school office during this time. If you need assistance, email us and we will work to get you what you need. We are taking this seriously and working from home to enforce social distancing.

Monday is the only day that we will be at school next week and that will only be from 11-12 for the senior cap and gown pickup! Remember to pull up in the bus lane and they will bring it to you!

Remind students to be checking their school email as we are sending out paper versions of work for students who are not using a computer and the internet.

Stay safe and healthy!

Monday is the only day that we will be at school next week and that will only be from 11-12 for the senior cap and gown pickup! Remember to pull up in the bus lane and they will bring it to you!

Remind students to be checking their school email as we are sending out paper versions of work for students who are not using a computer and the internet.

Stay safe and healthy!

post_text:
Let’s honor the 2020 Senior Class!

Just because we're not at a physical school building doesn't mean that we are not going to honor the senior class of 2020!

Seniors should be receiving college acceptance letters now and through the end of the school year. Those who are moving into the military or workforce should also be securing jobs.

Please submit a "Signing Day Video" of your senior (like an athletic signing) with the student and their family wearing college colors/military or work attire and announcing that they will be attending (name of their college/university) next fall and pursuing a career in (their chosen field). Or, I have secured a job starting this summer at (new place of employment). Or, I have joined the military and will be leaving for basic training on (upcoming date).

All videos will be reviewed for appropriateness. Submit your videos to and direct your questions to staylor@ccisdtx.com and be sure to include the student's name with your submission.

post_text:
To Jr. High Parents and Students:

Paper Airplane Challenge
Create a paper airplane. The challenge is to see how many pennies you can have it carry and still travel ten feet. You can add objects to the paper airplane or modify it by the type of paper used. This is something that many age groups may enjoy. You may also extend this by challenging whose airplane design may travel the farthest or fastest. ✈️

post_text:
¡Nuestra ciudad, condado, escuela y estado deben contarse en el Censo! El censo no lleva mucho tiempo. Si se queda en casa con sus hijos, inclúyalos en esto como una experiencia de aprendizaje.

Estados Unidos recopila datos cada diez años. El Censo básicamente cuenta a cada persona sin importar su edad o estado de ciudadanía. Los números se utilizan para determinar cuántos representantes tiene cada estado en la Cámara de Representantes.

Nuestra escuela, como todas las escuelas públicas, recibe dinero del gobierno federal. El conteo del censo ayuda a determinar cuánto dinero recibimos.

¡Haga clic en el enlace y realice el Censo!

https://2020census.gov/es.html?fbclid=IwAR0pp2eZKh10zu7nYAv3rguAO7wAR74JTLvy52vbR-2LbbGy2QXvYAAif2s

2020CENSUS.GOV

Last one available, but MUST be ordered and picked up by 11:30! We will not be able to give out new hotspots until further notice. If you have problems with an existing hotspot, you can contact us at technology@ccisdtx.com. We will get back with you as soon as possible.

We are still receiving phone calls about the availability of Hotspots. We do have hotspots that are available for $50 per month. They are unlimited but could throttle after 25 GB. No one in the last year has ever reported any throttling of the speed. Signup on the link below. You will have to scroll to the bottom and fill out the form. Use your child's name and grade as the email. There is NO contract. You can get the device for one month and cancel it. Remember to use or create a PayPal account. If you do not, it creates all kinds of problems for you and us in the future.

post_text:
Our town, county, school, and state need to be counted in the Census! The Census does not take very much time. If you are staying at home with your children, include them in this as a learning experience.

The USA collects data every ten years. The Census basically counts every person no matter their age or citizenship status. The numbers are then used to determine how many representatives each state has in the House of Representatives.

Our school, like every public school, receives money from the federal government. The Census count helps to determine how much money we receive.

Please click the link and take the Census!

https://vimeo.com/camlightvideo/census2020

2020CENSUS.GOV

post_text:
Parents and Teachers with Hotspots.
You can help prevent swollen batteries in your Hotspot!
Don't put them in the window with the sunshine heating them up!
Don't leave them in a hot car!
Unplug them and let them totally drain the battery occasionally or every day if possible.
Turn the hotspot off and let it occasionally "rest" in order to cool down.

post_text: A message from Mr. Seago for the fifth graders.
shared_text:
Joel Seago
March 20 at 12:20 PM ·

Hang in there kiddos! Your teachers have worked hard to plan some activities to bridge the gap of the days we are away from school. We are concerned about your health and well-being. Most of all, we want you to know you are missed, and we look forward to seeing you all again soon! Stay safe and enjoy your family time!

To my social studies students: you guys are making history right now. This nation is experiencing something that we’ve never really seen before. 5th graders in social studies classrooms years from now will be studying what our nation and others have learned from this experience! You will tell your children and grandchildren about all of this one day. Make good choices, you will leave your mark. Make it a positive one!

See you soon!

We are providing the following resource as an Enrichment for your child. Click the Learning at Home Through Technology for more ideas that you can use with your children. There are also other websites on the Clever Home Page.
You can go to doghouse.symbaloo.com

- Good Afternoon Jr. High Parents -
Starting Monday, March 23rd thru Wednesday, March 25th you will be able to pick-up your student's instructional packet here at the Jr. High between 7:00 a.m. and 12:00 noon. We ask that you remain in your vehicle and we will bring it to you. The packets are divided up by 3rd-period rosters, so if your student does not come with you, please ask them who they have for their 3rd period. We look forward to seeing you!

post_text:
Parents:
We have 10 additional parent Hotspots. Go to our website and click parents. You will see a Payment Area and Information. Make sure that you use PayPal or set up a PayPal Account after using a debit card or credit card. Under child's email, you can just enter your student's name and grade. Make sure you enter a phone number and we will call you to determine a pick-up time tomorrow.

Unless your high school student is taking online classes, no child will be at a disadvantage if they do not have internet access. Any links or websites will be enrichment activities.

shared_text:
Corrigan-Camden ISD
March 17 at 12:35 PM ·

Attention High School students!

All students who are in Edgenuity classes have access! You always have access, whether it is on your phone or on a computer. You should continue working on your classes in order to not feel stressed when we do come back to school.

Many have been calling to ask if they are able to keep working and the answer is Yes!

We have a print out of where students stood as of Spring Break and we will alter the online plan to get you back to that point when we come back to school. If you were behind, now is the time to catch up! But, if you keep working you might even be ahead :)

Mrs. Rabano is monitoring so that any work that needs to be released for you can be done quickly. Send her an email if you need anything even faster.

post_text:
Today is St. Patrick's Day.

This is just for fun and to help our students adjust during this stressful time. No one has to do this!

Brainpop and Brainpop JR Login is ccbulldog and the password is bulldogpass. This can be used by our students for access.

Each student also has a unique login. They can access brainpop from CLEVER
http://clever.com/in/ccisdtx
Your child will login with their school email and their password.
firstname.lastnameYR@student.ccisdtx.com
The password is their lunch id for younger students.
If you want to do extra activities on Brainpop, you will need to login with your name, but you can watch the videos and even take the quizzes with the ccbulldog login.

Again, this is just for fun and to help our students adjust during this stressful time. No one has to do this!

We will give further instructions on helping you with instructional supports that are low tech so that no child gets left behind.

post_text:
REMINDER:

Corrigan-Camden ISD will begin serving both breakfast and lunch starting TODAY. Sack Lunches with breakfast items for the next day may be picked up at:
C-CISD Junior High
Rayburn Hills Community Offices
Reily Village at the mailboxes,
City Park on MLK Street
Hobby Park in Moscow.

Sack lunches will be available from 11 am to 12:30 pm. We will continue to provide meals Monday to Friday.

Anyone 18 years old and under may receive a meal but they must be present to pick up the meal due to federal rules. Please call everyone and/or share this message to remind them about this resource.

This is for ALL kids! Please do not feel that you are taking from someone needy if you come and you have enough food at home. We must have enough participants to make this happen.

Keep social distancing of at least 6 feet. This keeps everyone safe! Kids only have to be seen. They do not have to get out of the car if the parent is driving.

From High School Counselor Sage Taylor Gardner,
"The Coronavirus can be scary to hear about, however, being informed can help ease students’ minds. Below is a video that I found on BrainPOP that explains the virus in detail. BrainPOP is also an excellent source for engaging students with a variety of different educational topics. Remember to be there for your student, listen to their concerns, and talk with them about what is going on! If you need help finding resources, please reach out and email me at staylor@ccisdtx.com".

https://www.brainpop.com/health/diseasesinjuriesandconditions/coronavirus/

post_text: Corrigan-Camden ISD will begin serving both breakfast and a lunch starting Tuesday. Sack Lunches with breakfast items for the next day may be picked up at the C-CISD Junior High, Rayburn Hills Community Offices, Reily Village, the City Park on MLK Street and Hobby Park in Moscow. Please help us prepare enough for each location by filling out this form. Sack lunches will be available from 11 am to 12:30 pm Tuesday to Friday. Anyone 18 years old and under may receive a meal but they must be present to pick up the meal.

post_text: Thank you Lopez Pressure Wash. Proud that the owners, Rat and Ashley, graduated from C-CISD and that they entrust their children to our care.
shared_text:
Lopez Pressure Wash
March 13 at 12:08 PM ·

“Our children are our only hope for the future, but we are their only hope for their present and their future!”

With illness after illness presenting itself all around us, we felt a little tugging at our hearts to donate some of our time. We wanted to make some of the pleasurable things for children in our community safe to play on and ease parents minds!

Today we donated FIVE playground washes which went to the city, and to the school districts! We SANITIZED and CLEANED every inch of these playgrounds with care and precision! Thank you to CCISD and the City of Corrigan for allowing us to give back!

#communityservice #squeakyclean #slideby#randomactofcleaningkindness

post_text:
Attention Juniors and Sophomores:

A list of students that have received an invitation to apply to become a member of the National Honor Society has been posted at the high school.

For interested students there will be two afternoon informational sessions from 5:00 PM-6:00 PM on March 16th & March 18th in the high school cafeteria. Students will receive their candidate packet and general information regarding selection.

Students and parents are REQUIRED to attend. Students who do not attend or do not have a parent/guardian attend will be ineligible for selection.

If you cannot make these meeting dates or would like to ask questions please contact the NHS Advisor, Kacie Dewberry, at kdewberry@ccisdtx.com.

post_text:
Information for 2020 Seniors and their Parents:
Baby Pictures
2020 Seniors that would like to have their baby picture in the yearbook will need to have the picture to Mrs. Hight by March 31st. Having your baby picture in the yearbook is free of charge and can be submitted digitally by emailing Mrs.Hight at ahight@ccisdtx.com or a printed photograph to be scanned in. Please make sure that the child pictured is between the ages of infant and 1 years old. If you have any questions please contact Mrs. Hight.

post_text:
Information from Coach Warren

"Last Friday the CCHS Boys Golf Team competed in the Coldspring Invitational at Livingston Municipal Golf Course. The boys took home medals for 2nd place team. Congratulations to all the golfers who participated!

On Monday the CCHS Girls Golf Team competed in the Warren Invitational at Wildwood Golf Course. Even though the course conditions were very rough due to the rain, the girls performed very well!

Our next tournament will be at Neches Pines Pines Golf Course in Diboll! Keep up the good work CCHS Golf!"

post_text: The C-CJHS Girls Track team competed in the Crockett Bulldogs Invitational on Monday and did a great job. All the girls regardless of their grade participated as 8th graders and for many it was their first track meet ever. The girls competed against Lufkin, Palestine, and Crockett at the meet with the conditions being cold, wet, and muddy, however, the girls reminded everyone how Lady Dogs fight to the end and compete! The results of the race are not yet posted by the host team. The girls will be competing in the Groveton Indian Relays on Friday, March 6th (BPR).

February 20 at 8:31 PM ·

I’ve heard many times that teachers just “teach to the test.” Well this week my team not only taught the necessary standards, but we made it into a memorable learning experience. Isn’t that what it should all be about? After our Google experience this week, these kiddos can’t wait to learn more! #realworldskills

post_text: Mrs. Scarborough's 2nd grade students individually created forms asking about your favorite "something". They sent the forms to their classmates so they could vote. They then created graphs and made a Google Slideshow. Students inserted their pictures and explored many of the settings. All second graders completed this project.

post_text:
Message from Fatman Evans.
Don’t forget LAST youth baseball/softball signups tonight, 6:00-8:00 at the high school cafeteria!! PAYMENT IS NOT REQUIRED UNTIL MARCH 1st!!! If you cannot make payment right away, please come sign up anyway. We can work out payments, but we need to know how many kids we will have playing so we can get the drafts completed, and jerseys ordered in time for pictures. Please bring a copy of your child’s birth certificate with you, or we can make copies for you. If you can’t find it, we will work that out too! We look forward to seeing everyone there!!!
--

post_text:
Information from the Ag Teacher, Mr. Jordan Wisener:
"Made a few more great memories with our FFA students from Corrigan-Camden ISD! We had 5 students compete in the 2020 San Antonio Livestock Show and Rodeo Calf Scramble; Kalyn Smith, Heath Davis, Byron Helton, Nikki Mochman, and Brayden Dobson! Tough group of competition from all over Texas Today! We had two winners tonight from Corrigan, Nikki and Brayden! Brayden got in the top 3 spots and has a chance to come back and compete in the finals on Thursday Night and Nikki is two for two in the calf scrambles between Ft. Worth and San Antonio!!!! Keep it up Corrigan! A big Thanks goes out to all of our supporters and new certificate donors!"

post_text: On the 100th Day of School, Ms. Lankford's Kindergarten Class made 100 cards for Valentine's Day! Students created homemade cards with construction paper, crayons, and stickers. They will give out 64 cards to staff at the elementary campus then mail 21 cards to Mrs. Colson's Kindergarten Class at Pine Ridge Primary in Livingston and 16 cards to Mrs. Meshell's Kindergarten Class at Lansberry Elementary in Trinity. The three kindergarten classes have been pen pals since the beginning of school.
text: On the 100th Day of School, Ms. Lankford's Kindergarten Class made 100 cards for Valentine's Day! Students created homemade cards with construction paper, crayons, and stickers. They will give out 64 cards to staff at the elementary campus then mail 21 cards to Mrs. Colson's Kindergarten Class at Pine Ridge Primary in Livingston and 16 cards to Mrs. Meshell's Kindergarten Class at Lansberry Elementary in Trinity. The three kindergarten classes have been pen pals since the beginning of school.

post_text:
Mrs. Hight's Digital Media class has been working on creating their own commercials for everyday products. For this project, students were required to shoot the commercial footage with a camera and then use Adobe Premiere Pro to edit the footage and audio to create a successful commercial.

The following students were selected by their classmates to be awarded in the following categories:

Best Commercial Edit 2020-Airpods-Mauricio Ortiz, Travis Bell, Fredi Castro, and Cole Casper

Best Commercial 2020-Takuache Brands- Julissa Jasso and Janeth Coronado

Best Actor/Actress 2020-Julissa Jasso and Daniel Rojo.

Students are pictured left to right- Daniel Rojo, Mauricio Ortiz, Travis Bell, Fredi Castro, Cole Casper, Janeth Coronado, and Julissa Jasso
Congratulations students!
text:
Mrs. Hight's Digital Media class has been working on creating their own commercials for everyday products. For this project, students were required to shoot the commercial footage with a camera and then use Adobe Premiere Pro to edit the footage and audio to create a successful commercial.

The following students were selected by their classmates to be awarded in the following categories:

Best Actor/Actress 2020-Julissa Jasso and Daniel Rojo.

post_text: Congratulations!
shared_text:
Corrigan-Camden FFA
February 4 at 10:21 PM ·

Congratulations to our calf scramble winners from Corrigan-Camden FFA! We were 3 for 3 tonight for each of our students to win a $500 certificate to go towards a purchase of a show calf for the following year! We Will see you next year Ft. Worth Stock Show and Rodeo! Big thanks to our friends and sponsors of the Forth Worth Stock Show and Rodeo, Justin Brands Inc., and Texas Mutual Insurance for their support and the opportunity they give to our FFA Students! Congratulations also to the other Calf Scramble Winners from across the great state of Texas!!!!

post_text:
Information from Coach Chris Warren, Golf Coach.

"Today the CCHS Boys and Girls Golf teams competed in the Hudson Invitational at Woodland Hills Golf Course in Nacogdoches. Both teams performed well in their first tournament of the year. The boys team placed third out of 12 teams, with Kason Riddle and Luke King finishing in the top ten overall.

Boys- Luke King, Kade Elliott, Kason Riddle, Josh Durham and David Lazcano

Girls- Kaylee Conarroe, Jessica Felix and Whitney Vera

Congratulations CCHS Golf!"

post_text:
6th and 7th Grade Cheerleader and Mascot Mandatory Meeting!!!!!

Parents/guardians of 6th and 7th-grade students that will be trying out for Junior High cheer/mascot for the 2020-2021 school year will need to attend a mandatory parent meeting in order for their child to try out. Students that do not have a parent/guardian attend at least one of the parent meetings will be ineligible to tryout. Meetings will be held on February 3rd and February 4th at 6:00 PM in the Junior High Library. Parents/guardians need only attend one meeting.

post_text:
We want to share the following information to help protect our community.
.
"Personal data from over 240 million Facebook users was leaked and has now made its way onto the dark web for sale. Assume that your data was leaked, and no, there isn't anything you can do about it. The data didn't include passwords, but did include name, phone, email, fb profile ID. This data will be used for phishing. I just received a text from "Compass Bank" asking me to reset account info. I don't use compass, so it is an easy delete, but it could be confusing if the text purported to come from my actual bank.

Please be vigilant and remember that your bank/Microsoft/Apple/etc... will not contact you via text or email to "validate" your account. If you think that your bank is legitimately trying to reach you, go to the bank website directly or call them. Do not follow links in a text or email."
text:
We want to share the following information to help protect our community.
.
"Personal data from over 240 million Facebook users was leaked and has now made its way onto the dark web for sale. Assume that your data was leaked, and no, there isn't anything you can do about it. The data didn't include passwords, but did include name, phone, email, fb profile ID. This data will be used for phishing. I just received a text from "Compass Bank" asking me to reset account info. I don't use compass, so it is an easy delete, but it could be confusing if the text purported to come from my actual bank.

Please be vigilant and remember that your bank/Microsoft/Apple/etc... will not contact you via text or email to "validate" your account. If you think that your bank is legitimately trying to reach you, go to the bank website directly or call them. Do not follow links in a text or email."

post_text:
Corrigan-Camden ISD strives to instill the importance of giving to others and community service. The High School Leo Club is sponsored by the Corrigan Lions Club. Mrs. Amber Perez is the Leo Club sponsor.

Leo club members work to help our community by raising money for local needs and helping distribute food at the local food bank. Leo club members presented the the C.C.R.C. (Corrigan Christian Resource Center) in November with a monetary donation.

Back R to L: Jackson Kilgore and Elijah Rinehart
Front R to L: Sierra Poage, Catherine LaBlanc (CCRC Treasurer), Mary and Ned Smith (CCRC Assistant Directors), Eva Perez, Marlene Coronado, Kathryn Fisher, and Olivia Medina.

Leo Club students also helped the Corrigan Food Bank with their last food distribution of the 2019 year.

Back row L to R: Connor Harrington, Trace Willson, Jackson Kilgore
Front row L to R: Aundrea Cuevas, Nikki Mochman, Sierra Poage

post_text: The Leo Club is hosting its 3rd annual Daddy-Daughter Dance on Saturday, February 8th from 6 pm-9pm at CCHS. Invitations will be sent home with students the week of 1/13/2020. The dance is for girls in Pre K- 12th grade and their daddy or favorite big guy. Pre-sale tickets will only be sold until Friday, January 31st. Pre-sale tickets will be $10.00 per couple plus $5.00 per additional daughter. After Friday, January 31st tickets can only be purchased at the door the night of the event. At-the-door tickets will be $15.00 per couple and $5.00 per additional daughter. We look forward to seeing all of the beautiful girls and their dads there. If you have any questions please contact Amber Perez at amberperez@ccisdtx.com.

post_text:
Education is much more than just Reading, Math and Writing at Corrigan-Camden ISD. We strive to instill the importance of giving to others and community service. Over the next few days, we will showcase some of our fabulous students and highlight the ways they help our community.

Our Elementary students participated in a food drive to support our local food bank, Corrigan Christian Resource Center (CCRC). Our students held the drive as part of their character education. Collected food items were donated to the Corrigan Christian Resource Center (CCRC) to help members of our community with food during the holiday season. CCRC is located at 915 S. Home Street and is open the 2nd Saturday of each month from 9:00 a.m. until Noon.
C-C Elementary would like to thank all students and their parents who participated in the food drive.

Students pictured L to R: Aubrey Burks, Isabella Rivera, Reggie Owens, Allen Poage, Xavier Dukes, Adalyn Harrington, Daniel Rivera, and Francisco Rivera.

post_text:
'Tis the Season of Giving.
The Elementary School would like to recognize Sandra Whittington for giving so much to our children. Ms. Whittington is a retired C-C High School math teacher who now substitutes for our schools. She decided to help our students recycle crayons that would have ended up in the landfill. Last year our students collected 18 gallons of crayons. Ms. Whittington spent 4 hours each weekday in June taking the paper wrapping off of each crayon. She then melted the crayons to make new designer crayons for our students. How cool is that? We have Christmas trees, unicorns, dinosaurs, french fries and even car crayons which she distributes back to our children. Thank you, Ms. Whittington, for loving our students!
text:

Ms. Whittington spent 4 hours each weekday in June taking the paper wrapping off of each crayon. She then melted the crayons to make new designer crayons for our students. How cool is that? We have Christmas trees, unicorns, dinosaurs, french fries and even car crayons which she distributes back to our children. Thank you, Ms. Whittington, for loving our students!

Our students and staff helping our community save lives by donating blood. Bulldog Family Proud!
C-CHS had the Commit for Life blood drive on Tuesday, December 17. According to Melissa Hubbard, Blood Drive Coordinator, " We had a total of 16 successful donors and collected 22 products, which means we were able to help and sustain up to 66 lives. I’m so very proud of the Corrigan Camden students that participated in the Commit for life".

post_text: First-grade students in Mrs. Harrington’s class wrote letters to Santa Claus. Before mailing the letters, Mrs. Harrington made copies of these priceless letters just in case there was a problem and Santa did not get the letters. We are pleased to report that tracking of the letters indicate that they arrived on time at the North Pole and that Santa has read each and every letter. The copies of the letters have been released to the Polk County Enterprise #polkcountyenterprise so that parents and grandparents can anticipate the arrival of any large gifts or gifts that are alive on Christmas. Josie Jones is pictured delivering the envelope to the Elementary School secretary, Carrie Hibbs.

The copies of the letters have been released to the Polk County Enterprise #polkcountyenterprise so that parents and grandparents can anticipate the arrival of any large gifts or gifts that are alive on Christmas. post_text: State FFA Officers visited the C-C ISD FFA Chapter members on Wednesday, December 4th. The three officers presented a program on "Confidence" and involved the audience of students from the Elementary, Junior High and High Schools. Students practiced complimenting each other as an example of confidence. Students learned the power of positive "cheering" others on to help them be successful. The FFA State Officers stressed that "We are the sum of the 5 people we hang out with the most". Students learned the 3 P's of Confidence: Perspective, People and Performance.

post_text:
The Lady Dog Varsity Team will be in action this Friday evening at home against Leggett with the tip-off scheduled for 5:00 pm. Come out and support them!

The Varsity Girls’ Basketball Team moved to 2-0 on the season with a 42-31 win over Garrison. Patience Geiger led the way for the Lady Dogs with 11 points, 11 rebounds, 7 steals and 4 blocked shots. Ladeja Daniels also had a stellar night with 11 points, 3 steals, and 4 blocked shots. A third Lady Dog, Monica Cooper, also had 11 points on the evening. On top of a great defensive night, Cooper also contributed 3 blocked shots. The scoring for the Lady Dogs was rounded out by Essence Sanders with 6 points and Alyric Berry with 4 points.

Ladeja Daniels also had a stellar night with 11 points, 3 steals, and 4 blocked shots. A third Lady Dog, Monica Cooper, also had 11 points on the evening. On top of a great defensive night, Cooper also contributed 3 blocked shots. The scoring for the Lady Dogs was rounded out by Essence Sanders with 6 points and Alyric Berry with 4 points.

post_text:
Parents: We all want to help our children learn to read and sometimes we all need help to pick out books that are appropriate for our child's reading level. The State of Texas offers the linked website as a resource for parents. Parents can enter the Lexile results from the STAAR Test or other sources and it will find leveled appropriate books for your child. Try it out!
https://texasassessment.gov/families/literacy-and-lexiles/find-a-book/#/0L/0L/-1

post_text:
The Lady Dog basketball team opened the season with a 47-25 win over Leggett. Patience Geiger led the way for the Lady Dogs with 13 points, 21 rebounds, and 8 steals. Essence Sanders also had a standout performance with 11 points, 9 rebounds, and 10 assists. Monica Cooper followed with 10 points, 6 rebounds, and 2 steals. Amiyah Jones added 8 points. Ladeja Daniels contributed 3 points, 8 rebounds, and 5 steals. Alyric Berry finished the night with 2 points, and Paige Standley finished with 7 rebounds and 1 steal.

The Lady Dogs will be back in action next Tuesday night, Nov. 19, when they travel to Garrison for a 5:00 JV tip-off. The Varsity team will play immediately following the JV game.

Thank You, Coach Hall for the information!
text:
The Lady Dog basketball team opened the season with a 47-25 win over Leggett. Patience Geiger led the way for the Lady Dogs with 13 points, 21 rebounds, and 8 steals. Essence Sanders also had a standout performance with 11 points, 9 rebounds, and 10 assists. Monica Cooper followed with 10 points, 6 rebounds, and 2 steals. Amiyah Jones added 8 points. Ladeja Daniels contributed 3 points, 8 rebounds, and 5 steals. Alyric Berry finished the night with 2 points, and Paige Standley finished with 7 rebounds and 1 steal.

The Lady Dogs will be back in action next Tuesday night, Nov. 19, when they travel to Garrison for a 5:00 JV tip-off. The Varsity team will play immediately following the JV game.

Thank You, Coach Hall for the information!

post_text:
Congratulations Varsity Football Players and Coaches for being chosen Dave Campbell's Texas Football 3A Team of the Week.
Quoting their website, texasfootball.com, "In a battle for district supremacy, the Bulldogs came out hot and never looked back, surging to a 17-0 halftime lead and stymying Anderson-Shiro en route to a 23-6 victory, handing the Owls their first loss of the year."

post_text: Juavari Flynn is a 10th-grade student who we would like to recognize for his positive attitude and superb manners. According to Mrs. Rabano, HS Asst. Principal, "Juavari always has a smile on his face". Today, Juavari saw Mrs. Torrez on the high school campus and went back to the door to hold it open as a true gentleman. Thank you, students for always being well-mannered and thank you, parents, for raising such well-mannered future adults. Juavari is interested in basketball and is working to have good grades and to be a success in life.

post_text: Our students are able to earn a CNA (Certified Nurse Aide) Certification in partnership with Angelina College. Mrs. Deana Parker is the instructor and is also the JH and HS school nurse at C-CISD. The CNA test includes a signification portion that is skills-based. One of the necessary skills is checking the patient's blood pressure. Students first practice on each other in the classroom.

post_text:
Don't be surprised when your Elementary School students come home today and start talking about the Lunchroom Superheroes.

Our Elementary Food Service workers dressed up as Superheroes today for National School Lunch Week. Be a superhero and SAVE THE DAY WITH A HEALTHY SCHOOL LUNCH!

Marcelina Sanchez is SuperGrains, Kanesha Reagie is SuperFruit, Debbie Hueske is School Power Lunch, Celiz Guzman is SuperProteins and Nellie Love is SuperDairy. Marie Freeman, Super Vegetable, was flooded out and will be pictured later.

All students who eat a free lunch all week will be entered into a drawing for a prize. One lucky Elementary student will receive a bicycle. A Junior High Student will win a 360 Speaker Box and a High School student will win a gift card to Sonic.

shared_text:
Corrigan-Camden ISD added 12 new photos.
October 2019 ·

The High School Boys & Girls Cross Country Teams along with the Jr High Boys competed in the Coke Classic in Lufkin with over 45 schools. Richard Thomas, Nazeli Hidalgo, and Gavyn Heredia were the top performers for each team in their division. Richard placed a close 19th out of 171 runners while Nazeli finished in 44th out of 147 runners, and Gavyn Heredia crossed the line in 35th place out of 300 Jr High Boys. Tra Thomas, Lizet Soto, Christian Aguilar, Tamarius White, David Baruch, Steven Smith, Ricardo Soto, and Pedro Ceniceros all had good performances in a meet that was a great tune up for the District 21-3A meet that will be held Wednesday, October 16th at Lake Tejas with the JV Girls starting at 3 pm.

post_text:
Picture Day will be November 7, 2019!

All students enrolled at CCISD, grades Pre-K through 11th and also all staff members will have their picture taken.

Parents can order ahead online or by the paper order form. Order Forms will be distributed closer to Picture Day. Each school has a unique order code that will be posted at a later date. Lifetouch does not have the codes ready yet.

Seniors will be taking their Senior Portraits also on November 7th. Senior Parents, no payment is needed at the time of the order. All Seniors will receive a proof slip and you may order online from the slip or turn money and order slip into Mrs. Hight to make your purchase.

If you have any questions please contact Mrs. Hight at the High School.

Order your 2019-2020 Yearbooks online starting today!

You may purchase books online by going to ybpay.lifetouch.com. Once on the site, you will need to enter the order code for the book you would like to purchase.
The order codes are:
High School/Junior High-5503520
Elementary-11075420.
When purchasing please include your child's current grade level. Order forms will be sent home with students within the next two months.

The Blue Quill Staff offers an Early Bird Special for individuals who would like to purchase the yearbooks at a discounted price. This sale will last until 12/14/19. The High School/Junior High books will be on sale for $30, after the sale they will be sold for $50. The Elementary books will be on sale for $15-soft cover and $20-hard cover, after the sale they will be sold for $20-soft cover and $25-hard cover.

If you have any questions please contact Mrs. Hight at the High School.

post_text:
Corrigan-Camden High School students are able to receive CNA certification upon the successful completion of the Certified Nurse Aide course and passing the state test. Students attend the class at the high school, but the course is in partnership with Angelina College. A significant portion of the Certified Nurse Aide class is skills-based and the location is the Corrigan Long Term Care Facility. Students were given a brief tour on Wednesday evening of the Care Facility by their instructor, Deana Parker. Mrs. Parker is also the junior high and high school nurse.

Pictured are L to R Uriah Sweats, Lizet Soto, Instructor Deana Parker, Janeth Coronado, LaDereka Johnson Not pictured is Walter T. Bell.

post_text: C-CISD had GermBlast on each campus to perform a type of disinfectant process which is very safe. The goal is to protect our children and decrease absences due to illness. The GermBlast process kills microorganisms in the environment that cause illness and infection such as the flu, stomach bus, staph infection, strep throat and much more. GermBlast will be visiting our school regularly. Our partnership with GermBlast is not in response to any problem. C-CISD is dedicated to helping our parents keep our children healthy.

post_text: September 15th to October 15th is Hispanic Heritage Month. We will be showcasing lessons from our classrooms during the next few weeks. Hispanic Heritage Month pays tribute to the generations of Hispanic Americans who have positively influenced and enriched our nation and society. Ms. Lankford's Kindergarten class has been learning about these four people of Hispanic heritage. They will be adding additional people throughout the month.
text: September 15th to October 15th is Hispanic Heritage Month. We will be showcasing lessons from our classrooms during the next few weeks. post_text:
The High School and Jr High Cross Country runners competed in the Hudson Invitational Saturday that featured over 500 runners from 20 Schools throughout the area.

Natalie Farfan had another outstanding performance in the Girls Middle School division finishing in 8th place out of 109 runners while improving on her 1.5 mile run time.

Richard Thomas and Javier Gallegos were the top performers for the Varsity Boys in the 5K as both runners had top 25 finishes in a race that featured 110 runners who are some of the best Cross Country and Track distance runners in the state.

In the Varsity Girls Division, Lizet Soto and Nazeli Hidalgo both had a good day and were also able to improve on their 2 mile run time on a course that presented challenges in certain area. Both girls were able to overcome them and compete at a high level.

The teams will be off this week before traveling to Lufkin for the Coke Invitational on October 9th and the District Cross County meet on October 16th at Lake Tejas.

Photos and information courtesy of Coach Rayford Sweats.

post_text: Ms. Cynthia Jones' 8th Grade Touch Data Class just completed the process of designing a cookbook. Each student had to key/format and design their favorite recipe. Students then began the process of reviewing, editing, proofreading, revising and adding pictures. After creating a cover design, they learned about mass printing and combining the pages. According to Ms. Jones, "My students had a fun time and were able to take a cookbook home to their parent or give one to a JH staff member".

post_text:
The Man with the Yellow Hat in the Book "Curious George" , aka Principal Larry Cupit, visited our Elementary School today giving out books. George's friend rode a three wheeled tricycle to different classrooms. Every student who had perfect attendance for the first six weeks was able to select a book from the tricycle's basket. 200 of our students had perfect attendance - 50% of our entire Elementary school.
We are so proud of our students for their attendance.
We wish we had been able to photograph each child. We would love for you to post a picture of your child and their book as a comment to this post.

The 2018-2019 yearbooks are in! Yearbooks are being distributed today and also Monday.

If you are a 2019 Graduate, your book is available for pick up in the High School front office.

If you did not get a chance to purchase a yearbook for last year, we have a limited number available for purchase. Elementary books are sold for $25 for hardcover and $20 for softcover. The High School/Junior High Yearbook is sold for $50. If you have any questions or would like to purchase a book, please contact Mrs. Hight at the High School. Thank you to everyone who purchased a 2018-2019 yearbook!

post_text:
Eric Wells, a CCHS Junior, is hard at work in Mrs. Hight's Graphic Design class. Eric's assignment was to add color to certain parts of the black and white image using Adobe PhotoShop. At the end of the tutorial, the Adobe expert trainer challenges the students to colorize the whole image. Eric has accepted the challenge and is doing an excellent job transforming this image.

This year the Graphic Design students are working to earn an Adobe PhotoShop certification (ACA). This certification will help our students get into entry-level positions in the design world immediately after High School graduation.

post_text:
ADAC visited our Elementary school yesterday. They shared the book The Rainbow Fish by Marcus Pfister with our Pre-Kindergarten students in Mrs. Yarborough's and Ms. Smith's classes. The Rainbow Fish is an award-winning book about the most beautiful fish in the ocean who will not share his shining scales with another little fish. According to Teaching Children Philosophy, "All the other fish in the sea leave him alone, and he wondered why. He goes to the wise octopus for advice, and she tells him to give away his scales. Rainbow Fish reluctantly does so, except for one. In the end, he is less beautiful than he was before, but he has new friends and is now the happiest fish in the sea".
Parents can read the book with their children on youtube. Just search for The Rainbow Fish by Marcus Pfister.

post_text:
Corrigan-Camden ISD's Superintendent Richard Cooper and the School Board participated in the TASB Business Recognition Program. This program recognizes business and community groups who assist our school in educating our students. Both the Lions Club and RoyO Martin were at the September 16th School Board Meeting to receive their certificates. Sherry Hughes represented RoyOMartin and Carl Thomas represented the Lion's Club and is their President.

Other area businesses that were recognized are Lowe's, Walmart, Home Depot, East Texas Sports, Splash Kingdom, Salvation Army, Georgia Pacific Corporation, SE Texas Food Bank, Brookshire Brothers, Sonic Drive-In, Alcohol and Drug Abuse Council, Whataburger and New Life United Pentecostal Church.

post_text:
http://bit.ly/cchotspot is a shortened direct link to the payment portal,

Corrigan-Camden ISD is proud that we started offering Verizon Hotspots to our parents in early 2015. Verizon has shared our program with many other school districts and according to Verizon, by April 2016, eight other ISD's had implemented our program. That number has increased dramatically since 2016.

Parents: We are continuing this program which benefits our community and our school. If you would like to order a Verizon Hotspot, please read and follow the attached directions. If you need additional help or have questions, please email technology@ccisdtx.com and leave your name and phone number. We will call you as soon as possible.

Parents who currently have a Hotspot do not need to do anything.

http://bit.ly/cchotspot is a shortened direct link to the payment portal,
